intro: Ardisia hirsutissima, commonly known as the hairy evergreen ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that are densely covered with fine, soft hairs. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers followed by bright red berries that are attractive to birds. Ardisia hirsutissima is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
